channel.title: Interleaved RSS Feed
channel.description: This is an interleaved feed of the most recent entries from each RSS source, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Google Researchers Found Nearly a Dozen Flaws in Popular Qualcomm Software for Mobile GPUs
item.description: The vulnerabilities, which have been patched, may have novel appeal to attackers as an avenue to compromising phones.

item.title: Student raised security concerns in Mobile Guardian MDM weeks before cyberattack
item.description: This is the second cyberattack targeting the school device management service Mobile Guardian this year. © 2024 TechCrunch. All rights reserved. For personal use only.

item.title: The FDA Just Rejected a Bid for MDMA’s Approval to Treat PTSD
item.description: The agency has asked drugmaker Lykos Therapeutics to run an additional study on the use of the psychedelic drug in patients with post-traumatic stress disorder, pushing back its next proposal by years.

item.title: Smartwatches shipments see sharp decline in India
item.description: India's wearable market declined in Q2, primarily because smartwatch are not attracting consumers. © 2024 TechCrunch. All rights reserved. For personal use only.

item.title: Noah Lyles’ Olympic Run Is the New Normal for Living With Covid
item.description: Dozens of Olympic athletes competed with Covid as society increasingly treats it like the flu or the common cold. Public health experts warn that it's anything but.

item.title: Anysphere, a GitHub Copilot rival, has raised $60M Series A at $400M valuation from a16z, Thrive, sources say
item.description: Anysphere, a two-year-old startup that’s developed an AI-powered coding assistant called Cursor, has raised over $60 million in a Series A financing at a $400 million post-money valuation, two sources familiar with the deal told TechCrunch. The round was co-led by Andreessen Horowitz and Thrive Capital. Patrick Collison, co-founder and CEO of Stripe, also participated […] © 2024 TechCrunch. All rights reserved. For personal use only.

item.title: ATM Software Flaws Left Piles of Cash for Anyone Who Knew to Look
item.description: Six vulnerabilities in ATM-maker Diebold Nixdorf’s popular Vynamic Security Suite could have been exploited to control ATMs using “relatively simplistic attacks.”

item.title: How to ask Google to remove deepfake porn results from Google Search
item.description: The internet is full of deepfakes — and most of them are nudes. According to a report from Home Security Heroes, deepfake porn makes up 98% of all deepfake videos online. Thanks to easy-to-use and freely available generative AI tools, the number of deepfakes online — many of which aren’t consensual — skyrocketed 550% from […] © 2024 TechCrunch. All rights reserved. For personal use only.

item.title: 19 Best Back-to-School Deals (2024): Backpacks, Chargers, Laptops
item.description: It's time to put away the pool noodles and get those butts back in seats. Save on backpacks, iPads, laptops, and more.

item.title: Ecovacs home robots can be hacked to spy on their owners, researchers say
item.description: Researchers found flaws that could allow anyone to spy on the owners of Ecovacs home robots by hijacking their cameras and microphones. © 2024 TechCrunch. All rights reserved. For personal use only.
